item.title: Britain Pushes the Women, Peace and Security Agenda, but Will It Matter?
item.description: James Kariuki, Britain’s chargé d’affaires to the United Nations, says his country will continue to push the ambitions of the women, peace and security agenda as a permanent member and rotating president of the Security Council this month. It remains to be seen, civil society groups argue, how much the country’s obligations will prevail as women’s ... Read more

item.title: From rural margins to media trailblazers: India’s women journalists are rewriting the news
item.description: Far from global newsrooms and editorial boardrooms, a radically different model of journalism has been taking shape for over two decades in rural India.
